steps.description: Ensure that respective filter change frequency is in acceptable limit
Ensure that the valve of filtration setup leading to GLRE 1101/1107 is closed. Then open the valve leading to SSRC 1101
Switch 'ON' pump and re-circulate the reaction mass from filter outlet into SSRC 1101 for 20 min. + 5 minutes

Open the sample point & collect approximately 250 ml sample into a clean glass beaker and visually check for black or foreign particles (if any).If found, change the SSMF-1104 filter and repeat the operations from op.no. 3 to 4.
Check the cleanliness of the reactor.
Open the valve leading to GLRE and close the valve leading to SSRC 1101. Filter reaction mass through filtration set up (leaf filter, 1µ and 0.45µ filters) into the reactor
Apply nitrogen to flush out the mass hold up into GLRE through filtration set up
Charge PA (Lot-1) from the receiver SSRC-1102 into GLRE through filtration set up.
Apply nitrogen to flush out the mass hold up into GLRE through filtration set up
Cool reaction mass (RM) to 10°C to 15°C
Add 1µ and 0.45µ filtered PL into the reactor by maintaining mass temp. in between 10°℃ to 25℃ until pH of the reaction mass reaches 5.5 to 6.0
Send reaction mass sample from reactor to QC for pH test
Maintain the reaction mass for NLT 3 hrs in between 15°℃ to 27°C.
Cool RM to 10°C to 5°C
Ensure the PCS is ready to use.
Ensure the material holding tub ready to use.
Ensure the centrifuge is ready to use.
Load Lot-1 material into centrifuge and collect MLR into receiver SSRC 1103
Spin-dry the material for 5 to 10 minutes.
Wash the material with PA received from receiver SSRC 1102 to SSRC 1126 and collect the washed PA (PA MLR) into receiver SSRC 1113
Spin dry the material for 30 to 45 minutes
Unload the material into the tub through PCS.
Load Lot-2 material into centrifuge.
Spin-dry the material for 5 to 10 minutes.
Wash the material with PA received from receiver SSRC 1102 to SSRC 1126 and collect the washed PA (PA MLR) into receiver SSRC 1113 by applying vacuum
Spin dry the material for 30 to 45 minutes
Unload the material into the RCVD through PCS.
Load Lot-3 material into a centrifuge.
Spin-dry the material for 5 to 10 minutes.
Wash the material with PA received from receiver SSRC 1102 to SSRC 1126 and collect the washed PA (PA MLR) into receiver SSRC 1113 by applying vacuum
Spin dry the material for 30 to 45 minutes
Unload the material into the RCVD through PCS.
Load Lot-4 material into a centrifuge.
Spin-dry the material for 5 to 10 minutes.
Wash the material with PA received from receiver SSRC 1102 to SSRC 1126 and collect the washed PA (PA MLR) into receiver SSRC 1113 by applying vacuum
Spin dry the material for 30 to 45 minutes
Unload the material into the RCVD through PCS.
Open the manhole of RCVD
Check cleanliness of the RCVD & hopper
Charge the wet material into RCVD from material holding tub and centrifuge through PCS.
Close manhole of the RCVD
Switch "ON" the RCVD and apply vacuum of NLT 650 mm Hg
Apply hot water to RCVD and maintain the temperature between 40 to 55℃
Continue hot water (40 to 55ºC) circulation into an RCVD jacket for 3 to 4 hours to dry the material. collect MLs into the receiver SSRC 1116.
Stop hot water circulation to RCVD.
Close the vacuum valve of RCVD and break the vacuum by applying nitrogen
Switch off RCVD and open the manhole
Replace the manhole cover with cadcon valve with magnet for unloading the material
steps.remarks: Integrity of Magnet: Satisfactory/ Does not satisfactory

steps.description: Check the cleanliness of the Sifter & ensure the integrity of sieve and magnet
Record tare weights of containers (HDPE/Fiber containers) including outer Triple laminated aluminium foil bag and inner semi transparent LDPE bag).

Unload the material from RCVD by sifting through designated mesh into HDPE / Fiber containers containing outer Triple laminated aluminium foil bag and inner semi transparent LDPE bag and weigh the material on calibrated weighing balance.
Check the integrity of the sieve and magnets of the Sifter and RCVD / after completion of sifting.
steps.remarks: Integrity of Sieve & Magnets: Satisfactory/ Does not satisfactory

steps.description: Clean the outer surface of the containers with lint free cloth. Paste Internal Product labels on the packing containers.
Adjust the weights and notify QC for sampling and complete analysis using the Finished Product Sample Advice sheet.

verification_details.description: Is the Batch production record issued by QA ?
Are raw material input weights, in-house batch nos./A.R.Nos. recorded?
Are all approved raw materials used?
Are all operations performed, checked and signed?
Are all in-process testing reports attached to the batch production record?
Is temperature / vacuum data recorded in relevant columns of the BPR?
Is the yield of the product entered in the yield report?
Is the yield of the product within the, expected yield range?
Is the batch product passed as per relevant specifications?
Are there any deviations? if yes, are the deviations closed properly? Ref. Deviation No.(s):
Are all. relevant ATRş attached to the BPR?

finished_product_sample_advice_sheet.test_requested: IP / USP / Ph Eur. / BP/ In-house

test_specifications.specification: A white to pale yellow crystalline powder
Freely soluble in water, soluble in methanol and ethanol (95%), sparingly soluble in ethanol, very slightly soluble in chloroform and dichloromethane

Test A -IR positive The IR absorption spectrum of sample should match with the spectrum of working standard Test B - HPLC The retention time of R.HCI peak obtained from test chromatogram should match with retention time of R.HCI peak obtained from Working standard chromatogram Test C-Test for Chlorides 5 % w/v solution gives the reaction of chlorides
1% w/v solution is clear and not more intensely colored than reference solution BYS 5

Impurity A NMT 0.5 % w/w Impurity B NMT 0.2 % w/W Impurity C NMT 0.2 % w/w Impurity D NMT 0.2 % w/w Impurity E NMT 0.2 % w/W Impurity F NMT 0.2 % w/w Impurity G NMT 0.2 % w/w Impurity H NMT 0.2 % w/w Impurity I NMT 0.2 % w/w Impurity J NMT 0.2 % w/w Any unspecified impurity NMT 0.1 %w/w Sum of impurities other than impurity A NMT 0.5 %w/w
test_specifications.result: Impurity A: 0.08%10/10, Impurity B: NO, Impurity C: 0.02%10/10, Impurity D: 0.03/10/00, Impurity E: 0.02%.00/10, Impurity F: 0.01/ 10/09, Impurity G: NO, Impurity H: 0.06%.00/10, Impurity I: 0.04.1.00/00, Impurity J: 0.02/ 10/10, Any unspecified impurity: 0.23%w/w, Sum of impurities other than impurity A: 0.23% W/w

test_specifications.test: Loss on drying at 60°C + 2°℃ under vacuum for 3 hours at a pressure not exceeding 2.75 Kpa
